pageContext.claim: “We’re looking [at sending] from 2,000 to 4,000 [National Guard members to the border]. And we’ll probably keep them, or a large portion of them, until such time as we get the wall.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump says a surge of National Guard members at the border will last until he can build his promised wall. But his defense secretary, Jim Mattis, says that it's not a long-term strategy, that these forces will not have contact with migrants, and that he expects to have the added personnel at the border until Oct. 1. “Right now, this is not a long-term deployment,” Mattis said April 12. “This is not a long-term strategy. This is a 'buying-time' effort.”
